intro: Struthanthus phaeoclados, commonly known as the dark-leaved struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often dark green in color. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Struthanthus phaeoclados thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
